'''Mozilla Firefox''' is a [[web browser]] descended from the [[Mozilla Application Suite]] and managed by [[Mozilla Corporation]]. Official versions are distributed under the terms of a proprietary [[EULA]]<ref name="MozLicensing">{{cite web | title = Mozilla Licensing Policies | publisher = mozilla.org | url = http://www.mozilla.org/foundation/licensing.html | accessdate = 2009-03-08 }}</ref><ref name="mozeula" />. Firefox had 22.48% of the recorded [[usage share of web browsers]] as of April 2009, making it the second most popular browser in terms of current use worldwide, after [[Internet Explorer]].<ref name="hitslink"> {{cite web | title = Browser Market Share for April, 2009 | publisher = Net Applications | url = http://marketshare.hitslink.com/browser-market-share.aspx?qprid=0&qpdt=1&qpct=3&qpcal=1&qptimeframe=M&qpsp=123 | date = 2009-05-01 | accessdate = 2009-05-01 }}</ref>
+
'''Mozilla Firefox''' is a gratis [[web browser]] descended from the [[Mozilla Application Suite]] and managed by [[Mozilla Corporation]]. Official versions are distributed under the terms of a proprietary [[EULA]]<ref name="MozLicensing">{{cite web | title = Mozilla Licensing Policies | publisher = mozilla.org | url = http://www.mozilla.org/foundation/licensing.html | accessdate = 2009-03-08 }}</ref><ref name="mozeula" />. Firefox had 22.48% of the recorded [[usage share of web browsers]] as of April 2009, making it the second most popular browser in terms of current use worldwide, after [[Internet Explorer]].<ref name="hitslink"> {{cite web | title = Browser Market Share for April, 2009 | publisher = Net Applications | url = http://marketshare.hitslink.com/browser-market-share.aspx?qprid=0&qpdt=1&qpct=3&qpcal=1&qptimeframe=M&qpsp=123 | date = 2009-05-01 | accessdate = 2009-05-01 }}</ref>
To display web pages, Firefox uses the [[Gecko (layout engine)|Gecko]] [[layout engine]], which implements some current [[web standards]] in addition to a few features which are intended to anticipate likely additions to the standards.<ref>{{cite web | year=2009 | url = http://download-firefox.org/spread-firefox/gecko-layout-engine-and-mozilla-firefox/ | title = Gecko Layout Engine | accessdate = 2009-02-16 }}</ref>
To display web pages, Firefox uses the [[Gecko (layout engine)|Gecko]] [[layout engine]], which implements some current [[web standards]] in addition to a few features which are intended to anticipate likely additions to the standards.<ref>{{cite web | year=2009 | url = http://download-firefox.org/spread-firefox/gecko-layout-engine-and-mozilla-firefox/ | title = Gecko Layout Engine | accessdate = 2009-02-16 }}</ref>
